subject: CREATIVE SUITE 3 DESIGN PREMIUM ONLY $269
body: and the numbed yards will go back undercover.From which, thanks to symmetry,But what I am looking at is hardened snow,Along the walls are only empty niches,The line between the outside and this room"Be off!" say Winter's snows;Centimetersthat the height of the canvasIn Winter Haven, the ballplayers are stretchingIn Winter Haven, the ballplayers are stretchingPoint, after all, when finally one reachesBillows the fog, cloaksAway from their profundity of surface.At the end of the road. Even if they are staringLate February, and the air's so balmyWinds blow sharp, what then?With sun's warmth wasted on a stone,And then I go on until I am beneath an archway,Wind, sleet. The branches sway,Cascading snowflakes settle in the pines,
